project.teaser: Despite the multiple advantages of products remanufacturing, being widely recognised as an effective means for transitioning to a more circular economy, there is still need for improved research and experimental observations, to improve traceability and reliability of the...
project.objective: Despite the multiple advantages of products remanufacturing, being widely recognised as an effective means for transitioning to a more circular economy, there is still need for improved research and experimental observations, to improve traceability and reliability of the final products from end-users’ perspectives, as well as enhanced impacts monitoring. The primary R3-Mydas objective is to develop a multi-actor framework, integrating innovative digital technologies (ML for process and quality control, marketplace, graph models for defects detection, digital twins), advanced mechatronics (AM, laser-cladding, automated disassembly/reassembly) and newly developed approaches from SSH (extended TAM/UTAUT models, ethics and legal framework), for functionally, environmentally and economically sustainable circular value chains for remanufacturing of energy goods at the factory level (Oil&Gas crankshafts – demo 1, E-vehicles batteries – demo 2, Wind turbines gearboxes – demo 3). R3-Mydas will deliver unprecedented impacts throughout the targeted value chains, as follows: up to 60% time reduction in programming for remanufacturing; up to 20% increased product quality; up to 30% rework reduction [Demo 1]; up to 30% improved detection of tiny deviations from normal behaviour; up to 50% faster anomaly localization; up to 30% increase the number of different modality data streams handled; up to 20% faster fusion process [Demo 2]; up to 99% reusage rate; -90% prevention rate; -75% lead time; up to 85% raw material savings potential [Demo 3]. The Project will deliver a marketplace associating to each remanufactured product or services/component for remanufacturing a Digital Passport-like set of information, ensuring full traceability. Finally, a dedicated training programme will be designed and delivered by EITM, targeting the Project remanufacturing value chains (100+ training hours and 100+ diverse stakeholders engaged during the Project).
project.title: REmanufacturing, repurposing and recycling energy goods through advanced Mechatronic and Digital technologies
project.keywords: circular value chains for remanufacturing, advanced mechatronics, marketplace, traceability of remanufactured goods, SSH integration, remanufacturing process control, products quality control

article.title: Advanced mechatronic and digital technologies for remanufacturing energy goods

result.title: Requirements data collecting and Oil&Gas demo case process design
result.description: Description of the use case, target scenario and collection of all kind of data consisting the source for the rest of the WPs.

result.title: Skills gap inventory and plan to develop the training curricula
result.description: The document will report about: (i) the skills and knowledge areas that are needed, highlighting for each of them the existing gap in comparison with the current state of the workforce's skills and knowledge; (ii) the training curricula to be developed to address the most relevant skills and areas; (iii) the detail plan to developed the training materials / courses.

result.title: Robustness of remanufactured flange connections and stray current circuits simulation
result.description: Deliverable is validated via torque transmitting capacity. In an application/ gearbox level there is criteria for Nm as target and on a component/material pair level an acceptance in based on the validated friction coefficient. Simulation environment, methods and technical solutions are accepted if those fulfills international standard requirements. Also, commercial feasibility as serial manufacturing costs and engineering effort for defined application is a key process indicator. Acceptance and material saving potential can be confirmed when technical capabilities are documented. Measured behavior of a reference drivetrain for stray current should correlate to simulation for acceptance criteria.

result.title: Data Management Plan – initial version
result.description: A report that will (a) provide an overview of the datasets generated and used in the context of the project and the democases, (b) outline how data will be generated and/or collected and processed, subject to all relevant regulations, namely the GDPR, the Data Governance Act and the Proposal for the AI Regulation, (c) assess, on top of the methodology and standards to be introduced, whether and how this data will be shared as FAIR and how it will be curated and preserved, in direct alignment with the ethics requirements.

result.title: AI-based Battery Digital Twin Anomaly Detection and Diagnostics

details.authors: A. Tuschkan, G. Schagerl, M. Zivadinovic

result.title: R3-MYDAS life cycles assessment, including environmental, social and financial dimensions report (interim-PU version)
result.description: Report of preliminary LCA & LCC results. Sensitive information will be removed in order to facilitate the results dissemination.

result.title: Cognitive robotics & Quality control concept
result.description: Text document outlining on a first part the data pipelines that have been put in place and the variability in variables measured for state-estimation. It should include a sketch of the Kalmann-filtering approach to be taken for processing these data pipelines. In a second part, it will describe the architecture of the model to be created. This includes the dataset which will be used for the first training iteration, the ML framework being used and a list of parameters & performance metrics which will be the inputs & outputs of the model. This model should be an application-specific adaptation of a framework that has been shown to perform well in the literature

result.title: Plan for Dissemination and Communication
result.description: A plan to disseminate and communicate the project and all the associated elements, namely: (1) Project identity (logo, templates for reports, generic presentations) will be developed and distributed to create “brand identity” (2) Project social media accounts (e.g. Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube) will be created and managed; (3) Partners will use their institutional social media accounts to disseminate project results/outcomes. (4) Press releases to showcase the project concept, methods and results will be produced at the beginning, during and at the end of the project; (5) Multimedia content, including project videos and images to be made available to the consortium through internal communication and management platform; (6) Identification of Trade shows and conferences by all partners to publicise the project; (7) Presentations at conferences to accelerate the knowledge exchange and dissemination of results with local SMEs and promote networking with commercial and scientific community, as well as cooperating on and promoting activities related to other R&D activities.; By M18 and M36 the updates on the activities performed against the ones planned will be done.

result.title: AI-based Digital Twin - Anomaly Detection and Diagnostics for HV Battery Behavior and Performance

details.authors: A. Tuschkan, G. Schagerl, M. Zivadinovic

result.title: R3-MYDAS Business Models
result.description: The document will report the detailed formalization of the business models of the most promising business scenarios (starting from the 3 reference business cases of the project), currently unexploited at industrial level and made possible by the R3-MYDAS platform and its services. Each business model description will include a detailed analysis of the reference markets; the involved stakeholders and their interaction mechanisms; the definition of the value-propositions and revenue models and the underlying IPR management aspects.

result.title: AI-Powered Monitoring and Assessment Solutions for Improved Cell and Battery Testing

category.title: wind energy
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/energy and fuels/renewable energy/wind energy

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
